Vote Paul Haslam on the 1st MAY
Standing for
OLD BILTON
Harrogate TOWN COUNCIL
Paul Haslam
Independent Candidate
Bringing Local Government Closer to the Residents
It’s about trust - not broken promises.
The Town Council is the first tier of local government, focused on residents’ interests. My vision is clear: the well-being of the people of Bilton and Harrogate will guide all my actions.
The new council must influence North Yorkshire Council and hold public bodies like the NYC, NHS and Police accountable, ensuring our community has a voice in shaping its future.
About Me
Married to Kath, we’ve lived in Bilton since 2006. We have two dogs, Charlie and Sidney, who I run with daily. I’m not a career politician – I’m a resident who cares deeply about Old Bilton and wants to make a difference. I’ve spent 11 years as a councillor for Bilton and Nidd Gorge in Harrogate, campaigning for improvement.
Previously a CEO, I’m now a Business Transformation Consultant, and Executive Coach focused on leadership and career development. I bring business acumen and a proven record of delivery, ensuring council spending benefits all.
Old Bilton – A Fantastic Place to Live
Free from party dogma, my loyalty lies solely with the people of Old Bilton.
I Will Listen to You
I will hold regular community meetings to hear your concerns and ideas. My decisions will be based on what’s best for Old Bilton.
I Will Be Your Voice
I will be a strong, independent voice on the council, fighting for the resources and attention Old Bilton deserves.
I Will Get Things Done
I am committed to working tirelessly to address the issues facing our community. I will be a proactive and effective councillor.

Housing
Engaging with the Local Plan
- Ensuring the Harrogate Neighbourhood Plan is fully integrated into the Local Plan.
- Scrutinise sites included in the Local Plan, as these are likely to be approved for development. Locals must have their say.
- Local Plan must include strategies for transport, high-quality schools, youth facilities, healthcare and waste-water management.
Transport and Connectivity
Improving Local Infrastructure
- Ensure public transport is safe, frequent, reliable and affordable.
- Fix the No.2 bus.
- Safer speed limits including outside schools.
- Development of Park & Ride.
- A train station at Claro Road/Dene Park (with capacity for up to 400k journeys a year).
- Promoting safe cycle routes and storage to encourage active travel.
Crime
A safer place to live
Work with police and Safer Communities for our area to support initiatives to deter crime including:
- Tackle anti-social behaviour (ASB)
- Burglary reduction – increased police presence.
- Safeguarding young people, particularly from violence and exploitation.
- Combat violence against women and girls.
Protecting the Environment
- Fight for the eradication of raw sewage discharges into our rivers by collaborating with the Environment Agency and Yorkshire Water.
- Preserving our green spaces – especially Nidd Gorge & Bilton Triangle.
- Cleaner air, especially outside schools, by promoting green, affordable travel alternatives.
Supporting Local Business
The visitor economy contributes around £¾ billion annually to Harrogate.
- Supporting the BID, Chamber of Commerce, and existing businesses is essential, while encouraging new businesses to drive economic growth.
- Support modernising Harrogate’s town centre while maximising key assets like the Conference Centre (contributing £50 million annually to the local economy), Royal Hall, and Theatre as central development components.

Media Bio
Paul Haslam is the founder of a management consultancy practice specialising in Business Transformation and Executive Coaching for Personal Change. He holds an MBA from Manchester Business School.
Motivated by a desire to give back to his community, Paul was first elected as a councillor in 2014. Throughout his tenure, he has spearheaded several initiatives focused on improving infrastructure and promoting sustainability within the region. His pragmatic approach to development has earned him recognition and respect. Notably, he has played a key role in enhancing public amenities and advancing environmentally friendly policies. Currently, Paul serves as the Climate Change Champion at North Yorkshire Council.
Although he did not secure the Mayoralty for the York and North Yorkshire Combined Authority, Paul remains committed to serving his community. His campaign for Member of Parliament emphasises transparency in governance, increased community engagement, and practical solutions to regional challenges.

Meet Paul Haslam
Former CEO now Business Transformation Consultant and Executive Coach focussed on Leadership and personal and professional career development.
Dedicated Councillor for Bilton and Nidd Gorge in Harrogate for 11 years, – campaigner for change – successfully opposed council on a proposed relief road through an area of outstanding natural beauty; successfully tabled a motion to support bathing water status at Knaresborough Lido and now Climate Change Champion.
At my professional work
I help people and businesses transform their performance through delivering sustainable, measurable improvement.
With clients across the world, my management consultancy provides Executive Coaching and Business Consultancy including ESG, the Circular Economy and Mergers and Acquisitions (up to £100M).
In recent years as a CEO, I managed the sale and acquisition for £82.5m of a retail company based in London on behalf of the owner.
At home
Married to Kath, granddaughter of a Yorkshire coal miner. We have two dogs who I can be seen running with daily, Charlie and Sidney. We love living in Bilton, Harrogate where we settled in January 2006. We have two very grown up children and 6 grandchildren. I grew up in a corner shop which my mother ran, whilst my Dad worked as a “progress chaser” at Hawker Siddeley (aerospace). I confess to having spent much of my formative years in Lancashire but can honestly say I have now been in Yorkshire for past thirty years and so hope to be considered a local. However, I have been known to watch reruns of Peter Kay to remind me of a happy past!
At play
Outside my council aims which drive me, I am mainly seen running with my two dogs. I enjoy running and can often be found participating in the local park run.

In politics
I’ve been a councillor for 11 years, starting at Harrogate Borough Council. In 2017 as part of the fight against the relief road, I was elected to North Yorkshire County Council. I am now, the first ever the Climate Change Champion and I am promoting an environmentally friendly approach to everything the council does as part of business as usual so that it is sustainable.
I sit on the Transport, Economy, Environment Overview and Scrutiny Committee and make it a point to attend all the fortnightly meetings of the Executive, which are in Northallerton. I like to keep my finger on the pulse.
I am the only councillor on Food for the Future (Fix our Food) York and North Yorkshire in conjunction with the University of York
I also represent North Yorkshire at Transport for the North and chair the Scrutiny Committee.
If you were to ask what I have done then I might cite:
Leading the successful campaign against the Relief Road across the Nidd, supporting the residents around Knox Lane to get the proposed inappropriate development refused planning permission. More recently I stood in the Mayoral election as an independent candidate for York & North Yorkshire – the feedback of which encouraged me to stand as an MP candidate.
This year, I have used my locality grant to support:
New Beginnings Charity – supporting women after domestic abuse.
Resurrected Bites – reducing food waste, loneliness and food poverty.
Nidd Action Group – protecting the water quality in the Nidd.
Installation of VAS signs – improving road safety outside schools.
Bilton Historical Society – IT support
Bilton and Woodfield Library – contribution to refurbishment
Henshaws – environmental project
St John’s Church – Youth support work provision
Richard Taylor School – Fiction books for KS1
Open Country – IT support
Bilton Area Methodist Church – Family fun time
The Village Harrogate – Baby clothes exchange
My Personal Carbon Pledge
I consider myself fortunate to be able to invest in a variety of eco-friendly solutions. As an early adopter, I am eager to evaluate their feasibility and understand the practicalities involved. I am committed to making the viable options more attainable for the wider community. Once fully developed, green energy has the potential to lower our bills and significantly reduce our carbon footprint without costing the Earth.
